required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reader Study to Demonstrate That Use of ClearRead Confirm is Superior to the Use Standard AP/PA X-ray Image
clinical_study.official_title: Reader Study to Demonstrate That Use of ClearRead Confirm is Superior to the Use Standard AP/PA X-ray Image

collaborator.agency: Riverain Technologies, LLC, 3020 South Tech Boulevard,Miamisburg, OH 45342-4860

brief_summary.textblock: This is a study to determine whether or not a new type of software is, or is not, of benefit. The software, ClearRead Confirm, is designed to enhance the ability of radiologists to detect tubes, lines and wires that may be placed within a patients chest. These types of devices are commonly used for very sick patients in intensive care units and are also used following surgery and in the treatment of cancer. This study will test radiologists detection of the tips of these devices comparing the results with standard chest radiographs and the the modified chest radiographs.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Time for completion of tasks comparing two groups.
primary_outcome.description: Time for completion of tasks of identifying the tips of tubes, lines, and wires.

primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy in detecting the tips of tubes, lines, and wires.
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of accuracy in determining the location of the tips of tubes, lines, and wires, compared to the determination of the expert panel.

secondary_outcome.measure: Preference comparing the standard and modified chest radiographs
secondary_outcome.description: To measure the preference of the tested radiologists comparing the two groups of images with specific attention to visibility of tubes, lines and wires, and, separately, the detection of lung and pleural disease.

other_outcome.description: Possible induction of artifacts that could be confused with tubes, lines, or wires resulting in the radiologists identifying structures that are not there.

arm_group.description: The radiologists will be viewing two groups of chest images. The first group are standard chest radiographs.
This group of chest radiographs will be presented with the modified image. The modified image is intended to increase the visibility of tubes, lines and wires on chest radiographs

study_pop.textblock: There are two populations: the radiologists and the cases they will review. For cases, these are sequential cases selected by database search using defined search criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- For the radiologists, they must in in active practice of community radiology (non-university sites).
- For the cases, they must be patients who have a tube, line, or wire in their chest. A small number of completely normal bedside chest radiographs will be included.
Exclusion Criteria:
- For radiologists: Not in active practice. Working in a university hospital.
- For cases: children. Do not meet image quality criteria.

facility.name: Georgetown University Medical Center, Suite 603, 2115 Wisconsin Ave
